channel.title: Dunno how to use my VPN
channel.description:
Ok so I'm a bit bored and want to set up a VPN on my server to see if it's useful. I installed OpenVPN on the server (ubuntu) and the OpenVPN client thing on WinXP and I've got it all to connect n stuff, but my Windows machine doesn't appear to be using the connection even though it's active.
[IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/15ft8uu.png[/img]
So yeh it's all connected n shit, but I can't get on any of my network folders etc so I'm guessing my computer is just ignoring OpenVPN and using Wireless to use the internet. Obviously OpenVPN needs Wireless active so it can connect to the VPN via the internet.
I also checked out the connection priorities, but they were correct:
[IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/jg2nv5.png[/img]
I restarted a few times too. So how do I make my computer ignore Wireless and connect through OpenVPN?
Ps, I'm using a different internet connection to connect to the VPN so there's no router faggotry going on here (hopefully).

item.title: Dunno how to use my VPN
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Mopman:

You either make it the #1 in the priority list, or you use an app like ForceBindIP to force the applications you want to use on the VPN to bind to that interface.

I’m pretty sure it’s already #1 in the priority list. Are you talking about something other than the list I posted?

I’ll try ForceBindIP anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: Dunno how to use my VPN
